basics.name: Mckenna Cisler
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: I'm a second-year student who enjoys programming in all its forms. My interests are still developing but I'm very interested in software engineering, large information systems, networking, and systems engineering.

work.summary: HCRI is an interdisciplinary coalition dedicated to researching and developing humanity-centered robotics. I work as a technician on robots involved in research, development projects, and demonstrations. I also work on pilot projects in humanity-centered robot design.
highlights: Working on hardware interfacing, voice communication, and user interaction design for "Tablebot" – a novel mobile telepresence robot designed to resemble furniture (C++, Python, ROS)
Co-developing node.js & NodeMCU-based wireless trash can monitoring system for Brown University Facilities Department
Setting up various ROS-based robots, including the TurtleBot and MIT’s DuckieBot self-driving car
Worked on Raspberry Pi and OpenCV-based dice-reading randomness generator

work.summary: A company interested in promoting STEM learning through instructional camps and development of education resources. I work as a developer of various educational tools and demos for use in our camps and to be sold to local teachers and schools, and also as an instructor for educational children's camps.
highlights: Developed an ATtiny85-based “paper circuit” controller to be sold to educators, including documentation, manufacturing, and marketing materials; shipped demo to local school
Developing and configuring High Altitude Balloon (HAB) on-board, tracking, and retrieval systems
Developed, assembled and demoed educational tools and resources, IoT devices, ScratchX extensions, wireless 3D printing tools, and a Raspberry Pi-based Sphero programming interface
Planning and running weeklong STEAM workshops for 3rd – 9th graders

work.summary: Brown Space Engineering is a club at Brown University dedicated to making space flight more accessible. It hopes to achieve this by launching a fully open-source CubeSet in Q2 2018 capable of being reproduced for ~$5000 in under a year.
highlights: Writing RTOS tasks in C for multi-frequency data recording and transmission packaging
Co-designing data collection structures and transmission schema; writing reliability tests
Working on boot sequence and satellite state handling systems
Optimized data structure RAM usage; converted all systems to static memory allocation

courses: CSCI 0190 - Advanced Introduction to Computer Science
CSCI 0220 - Introduction to Discrete Structures and Probability

projects.name: Wikispeedia
projects.description: Webapp interface for the Wikipedia Game
highlights: CSCI 0320 Term Project (team)
Co-designed websocket communication framework to provide simple interface for frontend developers; solved race conditions and multithreading issues
Implemented backend game state and player coordination system; wrote oracle and AI players to play games randomly to test fairness system.
Implemented Wikipedia crawling; designed backend caching system
Implemented algorithms for dynamic and fault-tolerant generation of page pairs ("games") using recursive web scraping
Assisted in deploying to Heroku; optimized server memory usage for limited resources

projects.name: The Social Playlist
projects.description: Music queue web app for crowd-sourced playlists
highlights: For Hack@Brown hackathon (team) - check out on devpost
Integrated with YouTube to search for and play any song
Added persistent user authentication
Linked playlists and "lobby" list to backend database for persistence

projects.name: Hubway Maps
projects.description: Visualization of socioeconomic data on Hubway stations in Cambridge, MA
highlights: For Brown Datathon hackathon (team)
Implemented scatter plot and assisted in implementing map to investigate possible correlations between wealth and presence of Hubway stations in neighborhoods

projects.name: Citation Converter (individual)
projects.description: One-of-a-kind webapp for converting between competeting academic citation formats
highlights: Wrote Python-based citation conversion engine; ported to Javascript for use on web frontend.
Currently working on interfacing conversion engine with the Citation Style Language (CSL) to support 8000+ additional citation styles.
Wrote Apache/PHP backend, including bug reporting and recording system.
Deployed for 2+ years at www.citationconverter.com
Demo video

projects.name: AlarmPi (individual)
projects.description: Raspberry Pi-based alarm clock with configuration interface
highlights: Wrote Python Tornado backend for responsive configuration & alarm-setting via a web interface
Wrote alarm monitoring daemon with sleep-cycle alignment algorithm
3D printed case and various custom electronics for physical user interface
